text: In the light of your findings in the above games, comment on the two claims: (1) if ‘iterated deletion оЁ strictly dominated strategies’ results in а unique strategy for each player, then the collection of those strategies is the Nash Equilibrium of the game; (2) if a collection of strategies is a Nash Equilibrium of a game, then those strategies survive ‘iterated deletion of strictly dominated strategies’. Both claims are true for static games with complete information, so correct answers will bear this out.
